content.rendered:
With barely any time to catch breath from Genesis Camp, This Week in Genesis #13 rolls around with another bumper update (the credit of course all to you, the hard working and talented Genesis community).

This week sees Genesis 2.2 agonisingly close to arrival (with some fantastic accessibility improvements), new themes from some of your favourite authors, plus a lot of goings on with Rainmaker.

Let’s go.

Genesis 2.2

Genesis 2.2, the next major release of the Genesis Framework, edged a little bit closer to release this week with the Release Candidate (close to launch version) of the 2.2 update now available meaning that developers and regular users can test 2.2 on their website.

#GenesisWP 2.2 Release Candidate is now available via the Genesis Beta Tester plugin. Probably last chance to test before final release.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) July 28, 2015

If all goes to plan, it is expected to be released on Monday 3 August.

@norcross goal is next monday.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) July 29, 2015

And Rian Rietveld, wrote up an extremely comprehensive summary of the accessibility changes and improvements you can expect to find in it (also showing just how much work has gone into this update).

Accessibility comes to the #genesiswp Framework! What changes in Genesis 2.2 and how to implement #a11y: http://t.co/gCPGDU2EPw

— Rian Rietveld (@RianRietveld) July 28, 2015

Themes

Web Savvy Marketing launches a new theme, Caroline.

Get Social w/ our new #genesisWP theme that uses #bbPress, #BuddyPress, #WooCommerce + @LearnDashLMS http://t.co/pG5DVEzIaG

— Web Savvy Marketing (@WebSavvyMrkting) July 29, 2015

Chinmoy Paul releases Jazz Pro.

Yesterday I released a new #GenesisWP child theme: "Jazz Pro" – A Personal Blog Theme. See the live demo here http://t.co/FfvEHsnLeP

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) July 26, 2015

ZigZagPress launches their 26th(!) theme, Vanish.

Introducing our 26th #genesiswp theme: Vanish. Perfect for agencies and flexible enough for almost any project! http://t.co/tssPbKeNbW

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) July 25, 2015

Showcase

Chris Lema’s site has now switched his site over the Rainmaker Platform and he shared a great article about the move. The stellar design was by Rafal Tomal: chrislema.com

The redesign and overhaul of Chris Lema: http://t.co/lyWRQeCDsz pic.twitter.com/Um6WjFx87D

— Chris Lema (@chrislema) July 30, 2015

New site from Marc Ensign, apparently with a little help from Brian Gardner: marcensign.com

Launched my new site last night with a little help from @bgardner and @studiopress! Love the #GenesisWP framework! http://t.co/vwpwDVCrUQ

— Marc Ensign (@MarcEnsign) July 29, 2015

Lisa B launches a new site for figathercole.com.au

New website launched today. Hope you like. http://t.co/S2v5EK85rB

— Lisa B (@lmbva) July 30, 2015

Plus not one, but three new sites from Emily White and Greg Young: creativewithkids.com, notimeforflashcards.com and teensgotcents.com.

Busy summer for me & @hbgreg. Check out our latest #genesiswp sites: http://t.co/UtJM4pt5qz http://t.co/Ztfms26M9t http://t.co/UWQ5RfRHTx

— Emily White (@emwhitedesigns) July 24, 2015

Articles

Interesting article from Rafal Tomal on the making of ChrisDucker.com (who’s now moved over to the Rainmaker Platform).

Making of: http://t.co/OtnW77s71N Redesign – http://t.co/4B9CWSDWp4 #genesiswp

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) July 29, 2015

The popular Genesis eNews Extended plugin was updated. If you’ve updated it shouldn’t have any impact on how your email signups actually work but you might just want to double check the styling (for what it’s worth, I’ve updated on several sites – including this one – without any styling tweaks needed).

Despite the jump to 2.0, today’s #GenesisWP eNews Extended update is actually pretty minor, but COULD impact styling.

— A Guy Named Kraft (@Kraft) July 27, 2015

Design Palette Pro adds support for Centric Pro, Generate Pro, Whitespace Pro, and Modern Studio Pro.

Last week we shipped v1.3.16 which included support for Centric Pro, Generate Pro, Whitespace Pro, and Modern Studio Pro! #genesiswp

— Design Palette Pro (@DesignPalette) July 29, 2015

Podcasts

The UK Genesis Podcast spoke to Bath based WordPress developer Paul Oaten.

We're live with @pca_uk! http://t.co/xa8KnflJpZ pic.twitter.com/HZqNgEsASs

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) July 29, 2015

Meanwhile over on the OfficeHours.fm podcast, Carrie Dils spoke to two ‘power’ guests on the show this week, Rebecca Gill of Web Savvy Marketing and Karim Marucchi, CEO of Crowd Favorite.

I am LIVE in 10 with @karimmarucchi & @rebeccagill on the podcast! Watch here -> http://t.co/swmSL12DG2 Tag your questions with #officefm

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) July 30, 2015

And finally…

If you haven’t joined the Genesis Slack community yet, now you have even less excuse, with automatic sign-up option now available.

Automated #GenesisWP Slack chat invitations, thanks to @BoiteAWeb. http://t.co/tbWNnKQX1r http://t.co/oKQKJRQNKr.

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 29, 2015

Have an awesome weekend.

PS If you missed it on Monday make sure you check out my interview with Genesis superstar Lindsey Riel. Plus, there’s just a couple of days left to win a theme and a TADA! Membership from Pretty Darn Cute so don’t miss out.

excerpt.rendered: Genesis 2.2 edges closer to release (with some fantastic accessibility improvements), three new themes, plus a lot of goings on with Rainmaker.
